intro: Alangium faberi var. perforatum, commonly known as the perforate alangium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic, with a distinctive perforation along the midrib, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species.
